00005 namespace isis

00010 class ImageFormat_png: public FileFormat
00011 {
00012 protected:
00013     std::string suffixes()const {
00014         return std::string( ".png" );
00015     }
00016 public:
00017     std::string getName()const {
00018         return "PNG (Portable Network Graphics)";
00019     }
00020     std::string dialects( const std::string &/*filename*/ ) const {
00021         return "middle";
00022     }
00023     bool write_png( const std::string &filename, const data::Chunk &buff ) {
00024         FILE *fp;
00025         png_structp png_ptr;
00026         png_infop info_ptr;
00027         assert( buff.getRelevantDims() == 2 );
00028         util::FixedVector<size_t, 4> size = buff.getSizeAsVector();
00029 
00030         /* open the file */
00031         fp = fopen( filename.c_str(), "wb" );
00032 
00033         if ( fp == NULL ) {
00034             throwSystemError( errno, std::string( "Failed to open " ) + filename );
00035             return 0;
00036         }
00037 
00038         /* Create and initialize the png_struct with the desired error handler
00039         * functions.  If you want to use the default stderr and longjump method,
00040         * you can supply NULL for the last three parameters.  We also check that
00041         * the library version is compatible with the one used at compile time,
00042         * in case we are using dynamically linked libraries.  REQUIRED.
00043         */
00044         png_ptr = png_create_write_struct( PNG_LIBPNG_VER_STRING, NULL /*user_error_ptr*/, NULL /*user_error_fn*/, NULL /*user_warning_fn*/ );
00045 
00046         if ( png_ptr == NULL ) {
00047             fclose( fp );
00048             throwSystemError( errno, "png_create_write_struct failed" );
00049             return 0;
00050         }
00051 
00052         /* Allocate/initialize the image information data.  REQUIRED */
00053         info_ptr = png_create_info_struct( png_ptr );
00054 
00055         if ( info_ptr == NULL ) {
00056             fclose( fp );
00057             throwSystemError( errno, "png_create_info_struct failed" );
00058             return 0;
00059         }
00060 
00061         /* Set error handling.  REQUIRED if you aren't supplying your own
00062         * error handling functions in the png_create_write_struct() call.
00063         */
00064         if ( setjmp( png_jmpbuf( png_ptr ) ) ) {
00065             /* If we get here, we had a problem writing the file */
00066             fclose( fp );
00067             png_destroy_write_struct( &png_ptr, &info_ptr );
00068             throwSystemError( errno, std::string( "Could not write to " ) + filename );
00069             return false;
00070         }
00071 
00072         /* set up the output control if you are using standard C streams */
00073         png_init_io( png_ptr, fp );
00074         png_set_IHDR( png_ptr, info_ptr, size[0], size[1], 8, PNG_COLOR_TYPE_GRAY, PNG_INTERLACE_NONE, PNG_COMPRESSION_TYPE_DEFAULT, PNG_FILTER_TYPE_DEFAULT );
00075 
00076         /* png needs a pointer to each row */
00077         png_byte **row_pointers = new png_byte*[size[1]];
00078 
00079         for ( unsigned short r = 0; r < size[1]; r++ )
00080             row_pointers[r] = ( png_byte * )&buff.voxel<png_byte>( 0, r );
00081 
00082         png_set_rows( png_ptr, info_ptr, row_pointers );
00083 
00084         /* This is the easy way.  Use it if you already have all the
00085         * image info living info in the structure.  You could "|" many
00086         * PNG_TRANSFORM flags into the png_transforms integer here.
00087         */
00088         png_write_png( png_ptr, info_ptr, PNG_TRANSFORM_IDENTITY, NULL );
00089 
00090         /* clean up after the write, and free any memory allocated */
00091         png_destroy_write_struct( &png_ptr, &info_ptr );
00092         delete[] row_pointers;
00093 
00094         /* close the file */
00095         fclose( fp );
00096 
00097         /* that's it */
00098         return true;
00099     }
00100 
00101 
00102     int load ( std::list<data::Chunk> &/*chunks*/, const std::string &/*filename*/, const std::string &/*dialect*/ )  throw( std::runtime_error & ) {
00103         throwGenericError( "png loading is not supportted (yet)" );
00104         return 0;
00105     }
00106 
00107     void write( const data::Image &image, const std::string &filename, const std::string &dialect )  throw( std::runtime_error & ) {
00108         if( image.getRelevantDims() < 2 ) {
00109             throwGenericError( "Cannot write png when image is made of stripes" );
00110         }
00111 
00112         data::TypedImage<png_byte> tImg( image );
00113         tImg.spliceDownTo( data::sliceDim );
00114         std::vector<data::Chunk > chunks = tImg.copyChunksToVector( false );
00115         unsigned short numLen = std::log10( chunks.size() ) + 1;
00116         size_t number = 0;
00117 
00118         if( util::istring( dialect.c_str() ) == util::istring( "middle" ) ) { //save only the middle
00119             LOG( Runtime, info ) << "Writing the slice " << chunks.size() / 2 + 1 << " of " << chunks.size() << " slices as png-image of size " << chunks.front().getSizeAsString();
00120 
00121             if( !write_png( filename, chunks[chunks.size() / 2] ) ) {
00122                 throwGenericError( std::string( "Failed to write " ) + filename );
00123             }
00124         } else { //save all slices
00125             const std::pair<std::string, std::string> fname = makeBasename( filename );
00126             LOG( Runtime, info )
00127                     << "Writing " << chunks.size() << " slices as png-images " << fname.first << "_"
00128                     << std::string( numLen, 'X' ) << fname.second << " of size " << chunks.front().getSizeAsString();
00129 
00130             BOOST_FOREACH( const data::Chunk & ref, chunks ) {
00131                 const std::string num = boost::lexical_cast<std::string>( ++number );
00132                 const std::string name = fname.first + "_" + std::string( numLen - num.length(), '0' ) + num + fname.second;
00133 
00134                 if( !write_png( name, ref ) ) {
00135                     throwGenericError( std::string( "Failed to write " ) + name );;
00136                 }
00137             }
00138         }
00139 
00140     }
00141     bool tainted()const {return false;}//internal plugins are not tainted
00142 };
00143 }

00145 isis::image_io::FileFormat *factory()

00147     return new isis::image_io::ImageFormat_png();
